title.narrative: OUTPUT 2: CAPACITY AND SYSTEMS FOR EARLY LEARNING, BASIC EDU SERVICES & SKILS

description.narrative: By 2022, public duty bearers have capacity and systems to adapt and deliver quality, equitable, gender-sensitive, safe early learning, basic education and skills in a changing education environment, including for those affected by emergencies.

participating-org.narrative: CIVIL SOCIETY ORGANIZATION: Community based organization

sector.narrative: Provision of (formal and non-formal) multiple-levels or alternative pathways of education (including in temporary learning spaces)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2022, public duty bearers have capacity and systems to adapt and deliver quality, equitable, gender-sensitive, safe early learning, basic education and skills in a changing education environment, including for those affected by emergencies.

description.narrative: 302,192 out-of-school children (55 per cent girls) gained access to pre-primary, formal and non-formal education through direct UNICEF support (including 77,201 children accessing early learning and 40, 627 children and adolescents in alternative learning pathways). Through continuous investments in partnerships and coordination, UNICEF supported system strengthening, service delivery and programme quality, focusing on alternative learning pathways and early childhood education. Disaster risk resilience and preparedness capacity were improved in 368 schools in KP and Sindh, creating structures to protect continued education for 29,440 children in disaster-prone regions | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:31/12/2019
